newsitem.title: USA: Acclaim, Spectrum to settle suit.
newsitem.headline: Acclaim, Spectrum to settle suit.

text.p: Spectrum HoloByte Inc and Acclaim Entertainment Inc said on Tuesday they had reached agreement on settling litigation regarding their games in development for use on personal computers.
Acclaim and Spectrum have been involved in litigation since July 9, 1996, over their respective license rights to the "Magic: The Gathering" card game and intellectual property.
Terms of the agreement include differentiation of each of the titles in the market.

Acclaim Entertainment will market its product for Windows 95 under the name "Magic: The Gathering - BattleMage." The product is being developed and positioned as a real-time, multi-player strategy game, based on the characters and scenarios of the fantasy adventure world of "Magic: The Gathering".
To further differentiate the products and avoid confusion at the time of product launch, Spectrum HoloByte and Acclaim have agreed to coordinate release dates for their respective products.

Acclaim anticipates releasing "Magic: The Gathering - BattleMage" prior to Christmas. Spectrum HoloByte has agreed, subject to Acclaim completing its release by January 10, 1997, to release its "Magic: The Gathering" game no earlier than February 1, 1997.
